dcterms:title: p15INK4B is an alternative marker of senescent tumor cells in colorectal cancer
dcterms:abstract: Senescent tumor cells are nonproliferating tumor cells which are closely related to cancer progression by secreting senescence-related molecules, called senescence-associated secreting phenotypes. Therefore, the presence of senescent tumor cells is considered a prognostic factor in various cancer types. In this study, using public single-cell RNA-sequencing data, we found that p15INK4B, a cyclin-dependent kinase inhibitor, is a novel marker for detection of senescent tumor cells in colorectal cancer.

fabio:hasPart.dcterms:title: Introduction
fabio:hasPart.fabio:hasContent: Senescent tumor cells (STCs) are present in a variety of cancer types and play distinct roles in cancer progression.

fabio:hasPart.dcterms:title: Materials and Methods
fabio:hasPart.fabio:hasContent: CRC samples were obtained from patients at Ajou University Hospital following surgical resection. IHC analysis was performed using various primary antibodies.

fabio:hasPart.dcterms:title: Results
fabio:hasPart.fabio:hasContent: Analysis confirmed that p15INK4B was significantly correlated with p16INK4A expression in CRC tissues.

fabio:hasPart.dcterms:title: Discussion
fabio:hasPart.fabio:hasContent: Integrative analysis revealed that p15INK4B is a reliable marker for STCs, but has limitations when considering OIS of precancerous cells.

fabio:hasPart.dcterms:title: Conclusions
fabio:hasPart.fabio:hasContent: In conclusion, p15INK4B is an appropriate marker for STCs in CRC and can reliably detect STCs in FFPE samples.
